verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:309
verses.text: XXXI.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:310
verses.text: And Andrew went his way rejoicing and glorifying God.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:311
verses.text: Then said Polyxena, Whither shall we go, sister?  Rebecca said, Let us depart whither thou wilt, lest my mistress send and separate us.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:312
verses.text: Polyxena said, Come, let us depart into the mountain to the lioness.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:313
verses.text: Rebecca said, It is indeed better for us to live with wild beasts and perish of hunger than to be compelled by Greeks and idolaters to fall into the filth of marriage.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:314
verses.text: So they began to journey, and, behold, by the providence of God, they met a man driving asses, who seeing them said, Ye are not of this country, and, as I see, ye wear not its dress.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:315
verses.text: Command therefore of your servant to eat bread and receive one piece of silver that ye may remember your servant when ye buy bread.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:316
verses.text: And he made haste and took the sacks off his asses and spread them on the ground, and made the maidens to sit upon them and said to them, Seeing that the wine which your servant carries is gathered by Greeks, tell me of what faith ye are, that thus we may taste of it.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:317
verses.text: Polyxena said, We, brother, taste no wine, and are of the God of Paul.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:318
verses.text: The ass-driver said.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:319
verses.text: Is this God upon earth?  Polyxena said to him, God is everywhere, both in heaven and on earth.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:320
verses.text: The ass-driver, being desirous to learn clearly, said, Does this Paul then have the same God that is preached by Philip?  Polyxena, learning that he was a Christian, said, Yea, brother, this is the God of all, whom Paul and Philip preach.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:321
verses.text: XXXII.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:322
verses.text: The ass-driver hearing this wept unceasingly, and Polyxena said, Has then the providence of God overtaken thee, that thou weepest thus?  The ass-driver said, If thou art desirous to learn wherefore I weep, hear the truth, for one ought not to grudge to tell the things of Christ.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:323
verses.text: I was a disciple of Philip, the apostle of Christ, and seeing how all his thought was towards the poor, I took all that I had and sold it.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:324
verses.text: And taking the price, I bought bread and wine, and divided them throughout the cities to those that had need, when therefore I had done this for some time in the neighbouring city, a certain maimed person cried out, saying (though it was not himself that spoke, but Satan through his mouth), I desire nothing, I take nothing from thee, because thou art a Christian.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:325
verses.text: Then the whole city arose against me and sought to take me, but some ran one way and some another, while I go through their midst and no one sees me.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:326
verses.text: And issuing from the city I gave praise and glory to God that thus I had been rewarded, and I prayed to my God that I should meet some one who knew his all-holy name, so that relating these things I might obtain relief.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:327
verses.text: For the men of this country will not hear at all concerning Christ, being full of impiety and filled with wickedness.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:328
verses.text: I exhort you therefore, take ye also one coin from me, and if it seem good, take ye rest also upon the asses.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:329
verses.text: Polyxena said, Mayest thou obtain mercy from God, brother.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:330
verses.text: But if thou wilt receive a full reward, save us as far as the sea, so that, if God wills, we may sail for Spain.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:331
verses.text: XXXIII.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:332
verses.text: The ass-driver, as if commanded by the voice of God, eagerly receiving the maidens, went on his way rejoicing in the Lord.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:333
verses.text: And he said to Polyxena, Alter thy appearance to that of a man, lest for thy beauty's sake some one snatch thee away from me.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:334
verses.text: And coming to an inn, they stayed there, and on the morrow they went forward taking heed to the way.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:335
verses.text: And behold there came past a certain prefect journeying to Greece, who seeing the maidens ordered Polyxena to be carried off on his chariot.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:336
verses.text: Then the ass-driver followed, crying and saying, A prefect does violence to none.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:337
verses.text: Why do ye this?  Then they beat him and drove him away.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:338
verses.text: XXXIV.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:339
verses.text: And he going on his way lamented, saying, Woe is me, wretched and abominable one.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:340
verses.text: Woe is me that thought to do good, but now I have wrought mischief.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:341
verses.text: Woe is me that my trouble and my running were unacceptable.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:342
verses.text: Would that I had died before yesterday, that I might not have met with these maidens at all.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:343
verses.text: But why troublest thou me, O wretched soul?  Let us go to Philip the apostle of God.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:344
verses.text: If there is not forgiveness for me, it is better for me to choose death in whatsoever fashion than to live with such evil and bitter conscience.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:345
verses.text: So he went and found Philip the apostle of Christ, and said to him, O disciple and preacher of Christ, thus and thus it has happened to me and befallen me.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:346
verses.text: Has my soul salvation?  Philip the apostle of Christ said, Be not distressed concerning this, my son, it is impossible for them to be dishonoured, seeing that no one ever overcomes God; for this same Polyxena, when she first came from the sea, I entrusted to a certain brother, who also was greatly distressed because of her running away secretly from his house.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:347
verses.text: Him also I persuaded not to grieve, for through her tribulation and wanderings many shall know God.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:348
verses.text: XXXV.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:349
verses.text: The prefect therefore carried Polyxena to the city where he stayed, and ordered her to be shut up in a chamber.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:350
verses.text: And one of the soldiers seized Rebecca, but the maid secretly escaping fled into the house of an old woman, who received the maiden kindly and entreated her well.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:351
verses.text: And sitting down she wept, saying, Alas, my sister Polyxena, I wretched one did not think that anyone was oppressed like myself, but now I am persuaded and know that all my misfortunes and tribulations do not compare with one day of thine.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:352
verses.text: And most grievous of all, behold I have been separated from thee and am again a captive, but do thou search for me even into the next world, my sister Polyxena.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:353
verses.text: The old woman said to her, What ails thee, daughter, that thou weepest thus bitterly?  Rebecca said, Suffer me, mother, to be distressed and to lament the great and incurable pain of my heart.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:354
verses.text: The old woman greatly compassionating her wept exceedingly, for the maid had told her all that had happened to her, and how through Polyxena she had believed in Christ.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:355
verses.text: So too Polyxena, shut up in the chamber, said, Woe is me, wretched one; alas for me miserable one; now I know clearly how the devil hates virginity, but O Lord Jesus Christ, God of all, since I dare not beseech thee of myself, I bring to thee the prayers of thy holy preacher Paul, that thou mayst not suffer my virginity to be destroyed by any one.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:356
verses.text: XXXVI.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:357
verses.text: And as she was yet praying, the attendants came to lead her to the couch of the prefect.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:358
verses.text: But Polyxena said to them, Brethren, make not haste to any one's destruction, for this time shall quickly pass away, and they that work together with the destroyers shall perish with them.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:359
verses.text: Rather assist strangers, that ye be not found strangers to the angels of God.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:360
verses.text: The men, being shamed by these words, went to the prefect and said, The maid from fear is seized with a violent fever.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:361
verses.text: And the prefect said, Let her alone.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:362
verses.text: And, behold, the son of the prefect came to Polyxena by night, and she seeing him was afraid, but the youth said to her, Fear not, girl.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:363
verses.text: I seek not to be wedded with thee as the bridegroom of destruction, for I know from thy prayer that thou art the bride of the God of heaven.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:364
verses.text: I know this God who is never overcome by any one, for a certain man of glorious countenance lately in Antioch preached this God, and a certain maid, whose name was Thecla, believing him followed him, and encountered dangers on account of her beauty, of whom I have heard that she was condemned to the wild beasts.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:365
verses.text: I therefore continually gazed upon the man, and he having observed me said to me, God give heed to thee, my son.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:366
verses.text: From that time therefore by the grace of Christ I have not gone into the sacrifices of idols, but sometimes feigning illness and sometimes involving myself in some business, my father said to me, Because thou hast no zeal for the sacrifices of the gods, therefore neither art thou in health, not being worthy of the gods.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:367
verses.text: But I rejoiced, hearing that I was not worthy of the sacrifices to idols; and, by the grace of God, art thou come hither as a providence to me.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:368
verses.text: Polyxena said, And what is the name of that man?  The youth said, Paul is his name.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:369
verses.text: Polyxena said, He is in my city.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:370
verses.text: The youth said, Come then, girl, put on my appearance, and go down to the shore and wait me there; I having taken money will come quickly.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:371
verses.text: XXXVII.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:372
verses.text: And one of the servants overhearing them told all this to the prefect, who being filled with great anger condemned them to be cast to the wild beasts.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:373
verses.text: And when they were cast into the arena, a fierce lioness was let loose upon them, which ran and embraced the feet of Polyxena, and licked the soles of her feet.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:374
verses.text: Then the prefect and all the city, seeing this fearful and wonderful sight, gave praise and glory to the merciful God, saying, Of a truth thou art, and he, that is named by Polyxena, alone is God, for the gods of the heathen are the works of men's hands, unable to save or assist any one.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:375
verses.text: Let them perish now, both themselves and their makers.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:376
verses.text: And the prefect straightway taking his son and Polyxena into the palace, heard from them in order the faith and religion in Christ without omission, and he and all in the city believed, and there was great joy and giving of glory to God.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:377
verses.text: And Polyxena said to the prefect, Be of good cheer, my lord, for the man of God will quickly come, who will perfectly teach, exhort, instruct, and enlighten you in the knowledge of Christ.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:378
verses.text: She however prepared in all haste to depart into Spain.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:379
verses.text: XXXVIII.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:380
verses.text: And as I, Onesimus, was sailing into Spain to Paul, I received from the Lord a revelation saying to me, Onesimus, the vessel in which thou now art will land in the parts of Greece, and thou wilt find on the shore of the harbour two maids and one youth.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:381
verses.text: Assist them and take them to Paul.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:382
verses.text: When we reached this place according to the command of the Lord, we found the maids together with the youth seeking a vessel.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:383
verses.text: When the maids saw us therefore, they knew that we were of the hope of Christ, and Polyxena running to us said, Verily the man of God cannot be concealed, for the grace and kindliness of his countenance makes him manifest.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:384
verses.text: And when we sought to sail away, the sea was troubled by the providence of God.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:385
verses.text: And there was with us a disciple of Paul, by name Lucius, capable in word to teach the city.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:386
verses.text: Therefore we remained seven days, and God opened to that place a great door of faith, and twenty thousand believed, and there was great joy and rejoicing in all the city.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:387
verses.text: And when the season was favourable for us to sail the prefect again constrained us, and we stayed another seven days, until all believed and rejoiced in the Lord.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:388
verses.text: XXXIX.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:389
verses.text: Thus now by the foreknowledge of Christ, the prefect sent us away with supplies for the voyage, sending also his son with us.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:390
verses.text: And when we had sailed twenty days, Polyxena was greatly exhausted, and we touched at a certain island for the sake of rest.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:391
verses.text: And behold, certain fierce and hardened men, coming down to us and seeing Polyxena, prepared for battle; but by the grace of Christ our men defended Polyxena and vanquished them, although the strangers were more numerous and more powerful.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:392
verses.text: Polyxena therefore fearing again to become a captive threw herself into the sea; but the pilot dragged her out, having suffered no harm.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:393
verses.text: Then we embarked in the vessel and fled, for the places were rough and wooded, and we were afraid to remain, and in twelve days we arrived in Spain, by the grace of God.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:394
verses.text: XL.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:395
verses.text: And Paul seeing us rejoiced greatly, and said, Welcome ye that have been troubled.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:396
verses.text: And Polyxena, laying hold of his feet, said, It may be that this trouble came upon me because I would have blasphemed thee, but now I beseech and entreat that I may not again be delivered into such troubles and misfortunes.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:397
verses.text: And Paul said, weeping, Thus must we be troubled, my daughter, that we may know our defender, Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:398
verses.text: XLI.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:399
verses.text: And while we were giving the letters of the brethren to Paul, one ran and told Xanthippe of the arrival of Polyxena.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:400
verses.text: And she made haste and came to us, and seeing Polyxena, was overcome by an unspeakable joy and fell to the ground; but Polyxena embracing her and caressing her for a long time brought her back to life.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:401
verses.text: Then Xanthippe said to her, I, my true sister Polyxena, went not forth at all for forty days, praying much for thee to the loving God, that thy virginity might not be taken away.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:402
verses.text: And Paul, the preacher of God, said to me, Her virginity will not be taken away, and she will come quickly.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:403
verses.text: And Probus said to me, It was assigned to her by God to be thus afflicted.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:404
verses.text: Seest thou how by many devices God saves many?  But now, my beloved sister, having unexpectedly seen thy face, now I shall willingly die.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:405
verses.text: XLII.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:406
verses.text: Then he who had carried her away came up again and sought for Polyxena, but the great Paul persuaded him to refrain from her, and he also believed and was baptised by Paul, as also the suitor of Polyxena believed, and there was great joy in all that city of Spain for the recovery of Polyxena.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:407
verses.text: From that time forward she left not at all the blessed Paul in her fear of temptations.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:408
verses.text: These things then being thus, all rejoiced in the Lord, glorifying Father, Son and Holy Ghost, one God, to whom is glory and power, now and ever and to all eternity.

verses.name: Life and Conduct of the Holy Women, Xanthippe, Polyxena, and Rebecca 1:409
verses.text: Amen.
